newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai copper futures ends up on LME gains.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai copper futures ends up on LME gains.

text.p: Shanghai copper futures ended up in active trading on Tuesday on overnight gains on the London Metal Exchange (LME), traders said.
The most active May 1997 contract ended at 21,880 yuan ($2,637) per tonne, rising 290 yuan. It opened at an intra-day low of 21,030 and hit a high of 21,900.
February rose 210 to 21,420, March 220 to 21,530, April 300 to 21,780, June 280 to 21,880. Combined volume rose to 70,620 tonnes from 17,030.
Copper opened mostly higher and moved at high levels for most of the session.
